procedure.title: Consultancy Services for Design of GAA Pitch and Nature Trail, Na Forbacha
procedure.description:
**Title:** Consultancy Services for Design of GAA Pitch and Nature Trail, Na Forbacha

**Description:**
The buyer, Bnaf Hurling, is seeking a consultant to provide comprehensive design services for a GAA Pitch and Nature Trail in Na Forbacha. The appointed consultant will be responsible for the detailed design of the pitch and nature trail, ensuring that the project meets all necessary standards and regulations. Key responsibilities include:

- **Detailed Design:** Prepare detailed designs for the GAA Pitch and Nature Trail, incorporating best practices in sports facility design and environmental sustainability.
- **Tender Documents:** Prepare tender documents for public procurement in accordance with OGP (Office of Government Procurement) guidelines, ensuring compliance with all relevant regulations.
- **Project Management:** Act as Project Supervisor Design Process (PSDP) to oversee the design phase.
- **Employers Representative:** Serve as the Employer's Representative during the construction stage, ensuring that the project is executed according to the approved design and specifications.
- **Tender Administration:** Administer the tender process, including the preparation of tender reports and liaison with funding bodies.
- **Construction Contract Administration:** Administer the construction contract, ensuring that all contractual obligations are met.
- **Contractor Management:** Deal with the appointed contractor, managing their activities and ensuring they adhere to project timelines and specifications.
- **Certification and Signoff:** Act as Assigned Certifier, responsible for administering the Building Control Management System (BCMS) certification. Ensure full certification and signoff as required by funding bodies and local authorities.

The ideal consultant should have extensive experience in sports facility design, environmental trail development, and project management. They must be familiar with OGP guidelines and have a proven track record in managing similar projects from design through to completion. The consultant should also possess excellent communication skills to effectively liaise with stakeholders, including funding bodies, local authorities, and contractors. 

**Evaluation Criteria:**
- **Technical Competence:** Demonstrated experience in designing GAA pitches and nature trails.
- **Project Management Skills:** Proven ability to manage complex projects from design to completion.
- **Compliance with Regulations:** Familiarity with OGP guidelines and ability to prepare compliant tender documents.
- **Communication Skills:** Excellent communication skills to effectively liaise with stakeholders.
- **Certification and Signoff:** Ability to act as Assigned Certifier and administer BCMS certification.
- **Previous Experience:** Successful completion of similar projects, including experience with funding bodies and local authorities.

**Submission Requirements:**
- **Proposal Document:** A detailed proposal outlining the consultant's approach, methodology, and experience.
- **CVs and Certifications:** CVs of key personnel involved in the project, along with relevant certifications.
- **Case Studies:** Examples of previous projects, including case studies demonstrating technical competence and project management skills.
- **References:** Contact details of previous clients who can vouch for the consultant's performance.

**Timeline:**
The tender process will commence on [insert date] and close on [insert date]. The selected consultant will be expected to start work immediately upon contract award. 

**Contact Information:**
For any queries or additional information, please contact Bnaf Hurling at [insert contact details].
